stackable

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • stackable.Direction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stackable

    public class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stackable
    Stackable - Direction
    Stores the numerical representation of a direction, as used by the map to update positions.
    Author:
    Karina Awoki, Renato Cordeiro Ferreira

    • Constructor Detail

      • Direction

        public Direction(java.lang.String dir)
          throws InvalidOperationException
        Default constructor.
        If the direction is invalid, throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        dir - String with the direction, as in a compass rose (E, NE, NW, W, SW, SE and black, for the center).
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException

      • Direction

        public Direction(int move,
         int dir)
          throws InvalidOperationException
        Secondary constructor.
        Stores the direction to be moved when updating a movement, accordingly to if the line is odd or even in the arena.

        If the direction is invalid, throws an exception.

        Parameters:
        move - Indicative if the line is odd or even when should be updated.
        dir - String with the direction, as in a compass rose (E, NE, NW, W, SW, SE and black, for the center).
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Stackable
        General function to print, in a more legible format, the stackable. It is used mainly with debug purposes.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Stackable
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representing the stackable.

      • get

        public int[] get(int row)
        Getter for the integer vector with the direction-update type.
        Parameters:
        row - Map's row in which an element is above. The return value changes accordingly to if the row is odd or even.
        Returns:
        Integer vector with the directions to be updated.
